transcription: Bum Sae Taegeuk Oh Jang is made based upon the Sun principle of Palgwe.  represent the wind. It symbolizes a strong, flexible, and humble state of mind. Poomsae Taegeuk Ohjang begins with a simple movement then progresses into more difficult movement. New techniques are hammer fist downward strike, elbow target strike, and cross stance.  From Joonbi stance first left low block in front stance and then left hammer fist downward striking. Then to right side right low section block and then hammer fist  downward strike. Natural stance.  single block in a back stance then step forward right elbow strike with the left hand augmenting the right fist. Then right turn around from here. Right single knife in the block outside on the left back stance. Then step forward left elbow strike with the right hand augmenting the left fist on your left front stance. To the left left hand low block right inside block on left front stance.  stance. Then right kick and right low block and left inside block. To the left, left high section block and left front stance. Then right side kick and left elbow target strike on your right front stance. Then right turnaround from here. Right high section block on your right front stance. Then left side kick  Then right elbow target strike. Then to the left low block and right inside block. Then right front kick in a crossed stance right back fist with kihap. Then turn around baro.  I  I  I  you
